title: A specifically designed sieve script can cause a DoS in lib-sieve during sieve script compilation via NULL pointer dereference

profile.name: Open-Xchange
profile.about: Messaging, collaboration and office productivity software for service providers

vulnerability_information:
# Reproduction

realcrash.sieve is the attached script
1. Build dovecot and pigeonhole
2. Run *sievec realcrash.sieve*

# Requirements

*include* and *variables* extensions should be  required.
One of the global commands (global/export/import) without any arguments should be followed by the same command with valid (string or string list) arguments;

# Problem

During vaildation of parsed script,  lib-sieve tries to join arguments of consecutive global commands with the same name (*export* with *export*, *global* with *global*, *import* with *import*) in *src/lib-sieve/sieve-ast.c:sieve_ast_stringlist_join*. However, we can create a logically wrong export/import/global command with no arguments and during a lookup of this command's argument list lib-sieve will fault.

# Crash log with ASAN

```
==19154==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address 0x000000000000 (pc 0x7f2a5d0d1564 bp 0x7ffc8e129150 sp 0x7ffc8e129130 T0)
==19154==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.
==19154==Hint: address points to the zero page.
    #0 0x7f2a5d0d1563 in sieve_ast_stringlist_join /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve-ast.c:814
    #1 0x7f2a5d17e869 in cmd_global_validate /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/plugins/include/cmd-global.c:181
    #2 0x7f2a5d0edf9d in sieve_validate_command /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve-validator.c:1409
    #3 0x7f2a5d0ef029 in sieve_validate_block /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve-validator.c:1561
    #4 0x7f2a5d0ef20c in sieve_validator_run /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve-validator.c:1573
    #5 0x7f2a5d147067 in sieve_validate /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve.c:206
    #6 0x7f2a5d14763a in sieve_compile_script /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve.c:278
    #7 0x7f2a5d147a3c in sieve_compile /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve.c:325
    #8 0x55c7e5745ba6 in sieve_tool_script_compile /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve-tool/sieve-tool.c:585
    #9 0x55c7e57422bf in main /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/sieve-tools/sievec.c:139
    #10 0x7f2a5c54eb96 in __libc_start_main (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x21b96)
    #11 0x55c7e5741af9 in _start (/home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/usr/bin/sievec+0x3af9)

AddressSanitizer can not provide additional info.
SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: SEGV /home/rumata888/Documents/Collaboration/Fuzzing/OpenExchnage/pigeonhole/pigeonhole_clean/src/lib-sieve/sieve-ast.c:814 in sieve_ast_stringlist_join
==19154==ABORTING
```
 # Possible Fix
The simplest fix is to check if the list of positional argument is NULL for the previous command before attempting a join. A possible solution is in the attachment *possible.patch*.
However, I think that it would probably be a more holistic approach to unlink a command with the wrong number of arguments from the AST alltogether.

## Impact

Well running sievec with this script ends in segmentation fault.
I haven't been able to set up the whole dovecot + pigeonhole infrastructure for testing, so I think you will be far better judges whether a malicious user can cause a full DoS with a malicious script of this kind.
vulnerability_information_html:
Reproduction

realcrash.sieve is the attached script

  1. Build dovecot and pigeonhole
  2. Run sievec realcrash.sieve

Requirements

include and variables extensions should be required.
One of the global commands (global/export/import) without any arguments should be followed by the same command with valid (string or string list) arguments;

Problem

During vaildation of parsed script, lib-sieve tries to join arguments of consecutive global commands with the same name (export with export, global with global, import with import) in src/lib-sieve/sieve-ast.c:sieve_ast_stringlist_join. However, we can create a logically wrong export/import/global command with no arguments and during a lookup of this command's argument list lib-sieve will fault.

activities.message: Thank you for reporting this,we'll look into this.
activities.markdown_message: Thank you for reporting this,we'll look into this.

activities.message: I cannot see how you could affect anyone else but yourself with this, can you please provide more details on why you think this is a security issue?
activities.markdown_message: I cannot see how you could affect anyone else but yourself with this, can you please provide more details on why you think this is a security issue?

activities.message: Hm. Yes. it looks somewhat like https://hackerone.com/reports/894446. If it's okay with you, can you freeze the issue for now, so that I check how dovecot+pigeonhole behave when a malicious user loads such scripts through managesieve? If it can't induce any failures in core, i'll notify you.
activities.markdown_message: Hm. Yes. it looks somewhat like https://hackerone.com/reports/894446. If it's okay with you, can you freeze the issue for now, so that I check how dovecot+pigeonhole behave when a malicious user loads such scripts through managesieve? If it can't induce any failures in core, i'll notify you.

activities.message: Yes. This doesn't affect anyone but the user submitting the script. I've found one more similar problem with CVSS 0. Should I submit it through hackerone or in some other way?
activities.markdown_message: Yes. This doesn't affect anyone but the user submitting the script. I've found one more similar problem with CVSS 0. Should I submit it through hackerone or in some other way?

activities.message: We accept bug reports to dovecot@dovecot.org. Thank you for reporting this bug, we'll make a note of this now.
